description:
Spencer G. Morgan is the principal of Spencer Morgan Law and an attorney. Mr. Morgan represents clients in Miami, South Florida, and throughout the State of Florida. Mr. Morgan started his career representing insurance companies, defending large companies, and negligent drivers and in the process learned how insurance companies and corporations make decisions. This experience was invaluable. Mr. Morgan has been following his passion since 2001 and has been exclusively representing those who have been injured due to slip and falls, trip and falls, motor vehicle accidents, trucking accidents, scooter accidents, moped accidents, and pedestrians injured by motor vehicles of all types. He also handles negligent security claims, construction accidents, on-the-job accidents against non-employers, and boating and cruise ship accidents.

After earning an undergraduate degree from James Madison University where he graduated with honors and attending the University of Salamanca, Spain where he made the Dean’s List, Mr. Morgan earned his Juris Doctor in 1996 from the University of Miami School of Law. Currently, he is admitted to practice in the State of Florida and the Southern District of Florida.

While representing the injured and recovering compensation for them, Mr. Morgan became a member of both the Million Dollar Advocates Forum and Multi-Million Dollar Advocates Forum, a title only held by a small percentage of attorneys in the country. For his high ethical standards and long list of successful results, he holds the highest peer rating possible of AV Preeminent* from Martindale-Hubbell.

A former intern for the Chief Immigration Judge at the Executive Office of Immigration Review, Mr. Morgan also interned for the Chief Federal Magistrate of the Southern District of Florida. He uses the experience gained throughout his career to more successfully advocate for persons who are facing life changes and outstanding bills.

* AV®, AV Preeminent®, Martindale-Hubbell Distinguished, and Martindale-Hubbell Notable are certification marks used under license in accordance with the Martindale-Hubbell certification procedures, standards, and policies. Martindale-Hubbell® is the facilitator of a peer review rating process. Ratings reflect the anonymous opinions of members of the bar and the judiciary. Martindale-Hubbell® Peer Review Rating™ fall into two categories – legal ability and general ethical standards
